abstracts.cdata!:
The objective of this Emergency Drought
            Recovery Project is to provide the Government of Moldova
            with urgently needed resources to assist recovery from the
            drought.  The project will increase the availability of food
            for the domestic economy and exports, and facilitate the
            reduction of poverty, through restoring production in the
            most important sector of the economy.  It will do so by
            providing inputs that are essential for the coming
            agricultural season.  At the same time the loan will assist
            in narrowing the balance of payments gap resulting from
            substantial incremental food imports and the sharp decline
            in agricultural exports resulting from the drought.  The
            project will finance inputs for the 1993 agricultural
            season, targeted towards those sectors which appear to have
            a long-term comparative advantage.  It will provide:  (a)
            US$15.7 million of pesticides essential to the 1993 fruit,
            vegetable and grain crops; (b) US$6.0 million for poultry
            feed; (c) US$2 million for seeds and seeding equipment; (d)
            US$2 million for spare parts for agricultural machinery; and
            (e) up to US$300,000 for technical assistance for
            procurement and disbursement.
